newsitem.title: GERMANY: More German compound feed plants seen set to close.
newsitem.headline: More German compound feed plants seen set to close.

text.p: Closures are set to continue in the highly fragmented German compound feed sector, industry associations FFMI and ZDGFD said at a joint annual news conference on Thursday.
They counted 568 plants with a capacity of more than 250 tonnes of compound feed per year in 1996 after 586 a year earlier.
Plants have been closing at a rate of 20 or so each year in the 1990s.
FFMI represents some 150 large industrial compound feed plants which account for more than half total national compound feed output of 19.33 million tonnes.
Some 60 percent of total output is produced at the 58 largest plants.
ZDGFD represents 1,000 small private feed producers, including a few hundred companies with less than 100 tonnes of output per year.
The two organisations are to merge later this year.
